article.title: Chern-Osserman type equality for complete surfaces in R^n

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula, developed by Chern and Osserman, relates the Euler characteristic of a minimal surface to what other properties?
choices: Area, Gaussian Curvature, Number of Ends
Gaussian Curvature, Number of Ends, Extrinsic Diameter
Extrinsic Diameter, Area, Number of Ends

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula, a result from Jorge and Meeks, builds upon the previous formula (1.1) by incorporating what additional geometric concept?
choices: Asymptotic behavior of extrinsic ball area

multiple_choice_question.text: This equation connects the integral of the Gaussian curvature over a surface with what other quantities defined on the boundary of an extrinsic ball?
choices: Geodesic curvature, normal projection of position vector, second fundamental form
Mean Curvature, extrinsic distance, geodesic curvature
Extrinsic distance, normal projection of position vector, mean curvature
Second fundamental form, Gaussian Curvature, Extrinsic distance

multiple_choice_question.text: This inequality demonstrates a key property of the function u₁(t) = (v(t)/t²) - (1/t²)∫_Mt |x||H| + (1/16)∫_Mt |H|². What is this property?
choices: u₁(t) converges to zero as t approaches infinity.
u₁(t) is monotone non-decreasing in t.
